Key Features of Shape Up

A methodology that brings clarity and focus to product development

‚è±Ô∏è

Six-Week Cycles

Work in focused, uninterrupted six-week cycles to deliver meaningful chunks of work with clear deadlines.

üî∑

Shaped Work

Projects are shaped before commitment, with the right level of abstraction‚Äîconcrete enough to estimate but abstract enough for creativity.

üë•

Small, Autonomous Teams

Small teams of designers and developers work together with full autonomy to figure out how to implement projects.

üö´

No Daily Meetings

Replace daily standups with asynchronous updates, giving your team more time for deep, focused work.

üé≤

Betting Table

Leadership decides what to build in the next cycle through a betting process, not through a backlog grooming session.

‚ö°

Circuit Breaker

If a project isn't working out, teams have the option to cut their losses and move on instead of extending deadlines.

The Shape Up Process

A three-phase approach to product development that brings clarity and focus

01

Shape

Define the problem and solution at the right level of abstraction. Create a pitch that explains the problem, constraints, solution, and appetite.

02

Bet

Instead of maintaining a backlog, stakeholders place bets on which pitches to schedule in the next six-week cycle during the betting table meeting.

03

Build

Small teams work with full autonomy to figure out how to implement the shaped work. They use techniques like scope mapping and circuit breakers.

Why Choose Shape Up?

Shape Up isn't just a methodology‚Äîit's a fundamental shift in how teams approach product development. By focusing on outcomes rather than output, teams can deliver more meaningful work with less stress.

üéØ

Reduced Uncertainty

Clear cycles with defined scope reduce the anxiety of endless projects and unclear deadlines.

‚ú®

Higher Quality Work

Teams have the time and space to solve problems properly instead of rushing to meet arbitrary deadlines.

üòä

Better Team Morale

Autonomous teams with clear goals lead to higher satisfaction and reduced burnout.

üß†

Focused Leadership

Leaders can focus on strategic decisions rather than micromanaging daily work.
